DOC.brief_summary: Silastic rings have been used around the gastric pouch in order to promote better weight loss after Roux-and-Y gastric bypass surgery ( RYGBP). However the investigators have shown that some patients developed gastroesophageal reflux disease after RYGBP in a previous study. The investigators hypothesized that the use of a silastic ring may play a role in promoting GERD after this operation.
DOC.brief_title: Effect of RING on Gastroesophageal Reflux (GERD) After RYGBP
DOC.detailed_description: This is a randomized controlled double blind trial designed to identify if the use of the ring induces food intolerance and vomiting which may lead a esophageal mucosal erosions and/or GERD symptoms.
DOC.criteria: Indications for bariatric surgery (BMI over 40Kg/m2 or over 35Kg/m2 associated to a lifetreating morbid conditions. Acceptance to be submitted to a 24h pHmonitoring and esophageal manometry No contraindication for gastric bypass Absence of previous gastric surgery Option for open gastric bypass Inferior and superior total teeth prosthesis Poor surgical conditions
